website_summaries.verdict: A round grill press makes a nice shape for most skillets.
pros: Wooden handle stays cool to the touch
Helps get the bacon crispy sooner
Can cover the bottom of a big pan
cons: This large press will not work in smaller pans

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received this product yesterday and had to use it right away. It's great for any type of meat and helps cook everything evenly. I never would have thought to use a round one instead of a square one but hellooooo it fits so much easier in my cast iron skillets. If you're looking for a cast iron press you won't be disappointed in this one!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I love this press for cooking bacon! First, the obvious, it's round. I've always wanted to buy a bacon press, but why rectangle in a round skillet? I've used this awesome round one several times in my 12 inch cast iron skillet and it works perfectly. It only takes about 6 minutes to cook thick slice bacon and if you like your bacon crispy, using this press will make very crispy bacon. It is a cinch to clean up. I honestly have not washed it even once. I treat it like I do my skillet and just wipe it clean with a paper towel. I can't wait to try it on some pesky pork chops.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but showed rust after first use.
customer_reviews.text: Seasoned the same day I received, used it the next day. I was a little disappointed that after the first use and cleaning that there appears to be a small amount of rust on the press. Not enough to warrant sending it back, but surprised it is there from the beginning. Otherwise, I would have given a higher rating. Fits perfectly in my iron skillet, sturdy, and heavy. An email I received requesting a review said the company was a small American business, but the box clearly states the product was made in Taiwan, only distributed by a company in N.J. Not that it matters, just thought that odd.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Ann Bransford

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product shipped.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with a shiny machining/grinding mark (about 2.5" long) so visible I don't know how someone placing the item in the box wouldn't notice. I understand the main function of the grill/bacon press is to do what the name implies, but there is a reason the decorative design on top is there - to also look good. An added feature that took some time and expense to implement, increasing the value of the product, for which the customer pays.
customer_reviews.author: Count R. Balanz

customer_reviews.title: Great press not just for bacon
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the bacon press, received it, and would like to say well done. I used the instructions provided to season the press and then used it to cook a steak. It worked so great that I tried bacon and a grilled cheese sandwich, although I wouldnt suggest a grilled cheese sandwich (flat). All in all, it works great and will recommend it to my firends.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa P

customer_reviews.title: Solid Press
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a shorter cooking time than the 15 minutes it takes to cook bacon in the oven. Frying bacon created cooked and uncooked hills and valleys and curled up ends. The Bellemain press eliminates these problems. The press is solidly built and fits perfectly in my 10 inch cast iron fry pan. Fried bacon now takes about as long as frying an egg and making toast...5 minutes. I wipe the press with a paper towel or cloth, keep it seasoned and store it right in the iron pan. I will use it for burgers and cutlets later on, but it's performance with bacon is worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Matysiak

customer_reviews.title: Good sear on meat, less splattering
customer_reviews.text: I like using this with chops and steaks in my cast iron pan on the stove top. I'm able to get a nice sear now, without so much splattering all over the stove and surrounding area. For just 2 pieces of meat for the SO and me, the grill press covers it enough to act as a splatter shield to a good extent. And the weight helps flatten the meat and prevent curling so I get a pretty good even sear. If I had one complaint, it's just that it's one more (heavy) thing to find a place to store when not in use. :-)
customer_reviews.author: JAMES EDWARD CASSIDY

customer_reviews.title: Returned This Item
customer_reviews.text: Received this press in about 3 days, great service. On first inspection it was apparent that this press was severely dished and not able to lay flat and perform it's intended function. Unfortunately I had to return it as unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lucier

customer_reviews.title: Well built, needs to be seasoned
customer_reviews.text: It is worth noting that you still have to season this cast iron, I used mine one time without doing so and it collected rust within 24h. The seasoning process darkened the look of the iron a lot, so if you are in it for the aesthetics keep this in mind.
customer_reviews.author: StickyWicket

customer_reviews.title: This thing is.....
customer_reviews.text: ...great. I'm telling you ya don't know a great home made burger until you use one of these. I always wondered why my burgers, even though I use better ingredients don't have that taste restaurant burgers have. The first time using one of these, I realized what was missing. Cast iron is the best option for these as well. the food gets iron from it, I read. the iron also absorbs flavor and they get better with use. This brand is a nice quality. Nice solid wooden handle. works =fabulous for bacon, gill cheese, chops, chicken and so on.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Great item but is not pre-seasoned
customer_reviews.text: This is an item I’d wanted for a long time. I like the utility of it and the price was great! All cast iron needs to be seasoned which I would have thought this would have been pre-seasons Ned given the wooden handle, but it is not. So handle must’ve removed to properly season at high heat. Otherwise, it is a great addition for stovetop skillet or flat grill cooking.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LOOKING, PERFORMS WELL... BUT
customer_reviews.text: The design, weight and function are all excellent. Used on 4 different occasions with a well cared for Griswold 8 skillet. After the 4th use there was a small glob of something remaining at the wood handle base. Appeared to be a leak of what I am assuming was glue, which had already solidified by the time I went to wipe down the press. There is now a space further up where the screw meets the wood. It is a bit off kilter, but still usable.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Beltran

customer_reviews.title: A *must* for bacon lovers (especially for sandwiches)
customer_reviews.text: Pro: 1) Makes perfectly flat bacon, just what you want for sandwiches 2) Flat bacon is cooked uniformly, although you will have to move inner strips to the skillet edges when flipping. 3) Fits a 10.5" skillet very well. As long as the press sits flat and is within 1/2" of the skillet's edge, will work fine. Con: 1) Grooves, which are used to drain grease, are a bit difficult to clean (however, this should be expected) 2) Odd shape makes storage a bit difficult (this is a just a whine, but something to consider)
customer_reviews.author: OphirDude

customer_reviews.title: WELL worth the price ~ you won't regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with this press. It is heavier than expected and the wooden handle, as stated does not get hot during cooking. My bacon now seems to cook faster and I'm able to get a nice crunch without burning one side or the other. I ordered two presses. One for myself and one for a Christmas gift. I like this one so much I'm going to order the oblong next. Very good deal for the price and will make a great gift for anyone who loves to cook. I'm so glad I ordered this!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: This changed my bacon game
customer_reviews.text: I like cooking my bacon in a cast iron pan. I can cook a couple of slices and use the rendered fat as a cooking fat for burgers, steaks, or other meat. The issue was always getting the bacon to cook evenly. This press prevented the bacon from curling, causing all of it to keep contact with the surface. The heat conduction cooked both sides of the bacon at the same time, speeding up overall cooking time. The wooden handle lets me clean it up right away with no fuss. This changed my bacon game for the better.
customer_reviews.author: Edd Black

customer_reviews.title: Bring home the bacon
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much exactly what I thought it would be. It’s all cast-iron press with a wooden dowel handle with two Phillips screws holding the handle on. So if the wooden handle ever does break it’ll be a simple fix just get another dowel and screw it in. It weighs a little over 3 pounds and seems pretty sturdy. I’m happy
customer_reviews.author: Karl  D

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I used my new bacon press this past weekend and it is WONDERFUL! Very good quality, very sturdy! And it is so cute! I wish I new what I could use on my counter top to set this on so I can display it when not in use. Or something to set it on while i'm cooking with it. Right now I use a cookie sheet so I don't mess up my counter top. I absolutely love it so much!
customer_reviews.author: ~michelle~

customer_reviews.title: Got it and don't regret it!!! :)
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST little kitchen tool ever! Sundays are bacon breakfast mornings and I would have to baby-sit the bacon so it would lay flat and cook evenly. This little press had liberated me!. I lay out the bacon in the skillet, put the press over, flip the bacon over and boom....FLAT, crispy bacon! I have also used the press to crisp up sliced potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: ajessee

customer_reviews.title: Makes Bringing Home the Bacon EASY!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this piece of cooking mastery! The press makes cooking bacon easy and quick, with no more spatula pressing and whatever else I used to do before this :D The press cooks bacon (or whatever else you might have) quicker and evenly so it never shrivels up and you sear everything evenly, eliminating raw or overcooked sections. Don't mistake simplicity for lack of genius here!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Burton

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made press. I haven't used it on bacon, but I do use it for grilled cheese and it is the perfect weight - it doesn't smash it, but it does get it pressed right down so all the cheese melts in side. It's heavy and well made and I love the designs on it.
customer_reviews.author: bouga

customer_reviews.title: It even looks good on stove
customer_reviews.text: I am a self taught cook. I am always trying to include new recipes, tools and create on my own. This iron grill plate seemed interesting. I tried it on center cut mignon steaks. Skillet fry time was cut in half. Steak had no less cooked parts. I believe my steak was better than ever. Will use on burgers, pork chops and chicken boneless thighs. A fantastic find. The cast iron plate is more than i expected. Best investment for frying!
customer_reviews.author: RGB

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in record time. I purchased the round bacon press this time. In the past I've used the old fashioned rectangle one which is lighter in weight than this one. Although it is heavier (cast iron) I love how this one fits inside my skillets. A keeper
customer_reviews.author: Bwag

customer_reviews.title: Bacon Press
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to make smash burgers, but so far I have only used it to cook bacon. The press fits nicely within my 12-inch non-stick frying pan and makes cooking bacon a breeze. The bacon renders quickly and because the press pushes down on the bacon and prevents curling it also prevents all the splattering. Once the weather turns and stops raining I will use it to cook bacon and smash burgers on my outdoor griddle.
customer_reviews.author: jzp

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen essential
customer_reviews.text: There are many weights available to use as a food press which are invaluable for ensuring a proper sear on everything from steaks to fish fillets. Also great for getting evenly crispy bacon strips. This one has the virtue of being simple to use with its wooden handle that remains cool so that oven mits are not necessary. It comes with easy to do seasoning instructions (just get a skillet large enough to accommodate the press, apply a thin coating of cooking oil to the skillet and to the bottom of the press and let it sit over low heat for 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Guitarman

customer_reviews.title: Solid griddle accessory
customer_reviews.text: Got this in to use with my griddle to make smashburgers and cook bacon. Works well for both of those jobs, smashburgers came out great using it. Bacon it was just average but still gets the job done. I have used it for burgers, bacon, onions, asparagus, all sorts of things on the griddle. This is a permanent addition to the griddle cooking tools. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cent Fl User

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 10 in cast iron skillet
customer_reviews.text: Very useful tool. Be aware that the cast iron posts that hold the sturdy handle will get hot, and find a place to put it when removing food from the pan, as it is hot. These are simply things you'll need to figure out in advance, but it is absolutely great for cooking bacon and patties. This is perfect for my 10 in cast iron skillet. The press is well made, no rough edges or rust spots.
customer_reviews.author: Aryn

customer_reviews.title: A great way to pan fry bacon.
customer_reviews.text: The Bellemain Cast Iron Press is a great product that simplifies frying bacon in my 10" cast iron skillet. I like using the skillet again instead of the microwave pan that lets the bacon wrinkle up and not fry uniformly. And, it makes great hamburgers with nice brown sear marks on them. I would rate it a 10 out of 10. Thanks for such a great product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: mrjmax

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and a generous sized grill press
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and large sized for covering most grilled or fried foods. Actually protects cooking surfaces from excessive splatter especially when food is in a cast iron pan with high sides. Should last for years. A few cons: The wood handle should be contoured to the hand/fingers for easier grasping. Handle is definitely not ergonomically designed. NOT made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Peter DP

customer_reviews.title: Works great, solid quality, family business, American made. Yes please.
customer_reviews.text: The bacon press arrived in good shape, was well packed. Construction is solid with wood handle attached firmly to cast iron press. Bonus: is a good looking unit. I followed the easy instructions to season my press. Same as with all cast iron cookwear. It worked great on bacon. I bought this because I had a batch of bacon curl up and half of it didn't get cooked. Those days are over. This press made uniform bacon that cooked quicker and came out crisper. Will try on sandwiches next.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Eating healthy now!
customer_reviews.text: The press works great. Now, instead of short curly pieces of bacon that are loaded with fat I get nice long straight pieces of bacon and almost no fat at all. Great for making grilled cheese sandwiches, too.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Nice Piece
customer_reviews.text: I just received it and seasoned it with peanut oil. It's a great add on to my 10" Lodge cast Iron skillet. It has some good weight. So far it's doing what I want to use it for. I heat it up in the pan so it is the same temp that way I can sear both sides of whatever I'm cooking at the same time. I accidentally purchased a second one, and I'll be using that one on my grill.
customer_reviews.author: Arjen Heitlager

customer_reviews.title: Good product...just handle carefully
customer_reviews.text: It works great. We use it for evenly cooked bacon and burgers. Only issue is the wooden handle is attached to metal bars...if you are not careful handling it, you will get burned. I dont know if it could be made any differently so, the advice is just be careful. Does a great job making and evenly cooked burger or bacon that isnt raw on ends. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect accessory for a Blackstone Griddle
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I use it all the time on my Blackstone Griddle Grill. It’s perfect for bacon, burgers and well so much more. It’s the perfect size and weight. Nice big handle on it as well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Great Size & Weight - Great for Big Smash Burgers Too!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice bacon press. We use it more for smash burgers and it works great. It’s sturdy & heavy, but most of all, it’s wide enough for large smash burgers for the guys. We use a piece of wax paper to help prevent the meat from sticking. Very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: JudyK

customer_reviews.title: Came well seasoned!
customer_reviews.text: After using this press for several times, I’m very pleased with it!! It hasn’t stuck to the food at all, so it came well seasoned. After use I just wipe it down well and keep it in a round cake pan lined with parchment paper
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE CURLY BACON!!!
customer_reviews.text: My bacon press was lost in a move and I had purchased a bacon rack to lay strips of bacon in grooves. What a greasy mess - AWFUL... and the bacon still curled and broke. When I read an article on top sellers at Amazon I saw this and remembered my old bacon press, so I immediately purchased one and I’m sooo glad I did! And it’s made in AMERICA!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover in OREGON

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the packaging and held this product in my hand I could feel that it was a heavy duty, sturdy product. I originally bought this for making bacon however I will be using it for much more. Pressing burger patties, keeping pork chops and steak flat, and anything else that i need weight to press down on. Highly recommend if looking to purchase a bacon press
customer_reviews.author: Hadar R.

customer_reviews.title: It's Great
customer_reviews.text: For cast iron, it's incredibly smooth on the bottom. For people familiar with cast iron, you are getting exactly what you think you are. For those who aren't - yes, it will rust if you don't dry it off quickly after it gets wet. Scrubbing with kosher salt will remove the rust. And it's just as big as it needs to be to cover a few slices if bacon.
customer_reviews.author: ZiggyTimu

customer_reviews.title: Get the sandwich perfect slices every time and if you want throw it ...
customer_reviews.text: Fight bacon curl! Get the sandwich perfect slices every time and if you want throw it on a grilled cheese or panni for some appealing grill lines. Wood handle works only ever had it warm but not hot after an al morning bacon fest for the fam. Cast iron is solid without being to heavy and seasons well.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Love it !
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought one of these long ago.....Great design with the slight ridged surface. Have used it on bacon and steaks. Works great. Most evenly cooked steaks I've grilled. Easy to clean. I spray No-stick on it after I wash it and store it like that... works just fine. It does get hot....I still use a finger mitt even with the wood handle cause the sides get hot.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: after seasoning the press, I tried it on bacon. The most straight and nicely cooked ever and over a relatively low temperature, resulting in a very crunchy bacon without over cooking it. Also used it as a weight over salted eggplant slices to help get out their water. Look forward to using on a burger.
customer_reviews.author: moliwyonlok

customer_reviews.title: I've now revised Like and don't like
customer_reviews.text: Revised: Used it this morning for breakfast cooking bacon. Left it out till afternoon to do the dishes and came back to find it already starting to rust. Needs to be square not round. Rusted in only a few hours. Like the weight The end of the wood handle could offer more protection and the metal part on the end gets very hot Didn't like was that it is round. I have to cut in half the bacon towards the edge of the round press to maximize the press area - make a round version and a square version
customer_reviews.author: DAVE

customer_reviews.title: Not very practical
customer_reviews.text: Not very convenient because I can’t see the bacon while it’s cooking and I do not like that I cannot use it in my nonstick pan so it was returned because you don’t indicate no non-stick pans on your listing I wasn’t gonna say anything but you asked
customer_reviews.author: steveSaundersMasterJeweler

customer_reviews.title: Finally flat crispy bacon !
customer_reviews.text: I really love my new grill press . Only used it on bacon so far but its nice to have bacon that doesn't get all crinkled up when you cook it . It makes for perfectly crisp bacon and it cooks faster . The other added bonus is less splatter on the stove and the large size worked perfect in my ten inch skillet . Wish I had bought one a long time ago !
customer_reviews.author: dawggie

customer_reviews.title: Worth it’s weight in gold
customer_reviews.text: This is the most excellent bacon press ever. It’s heavy duty and the wooden handle stays relatively cool while using. This is weighted enough to use for a pressed chicken or duck dish. I’ve used this several times since receiving and haven’t had an issue. I’ve also used this when cooking flat breads on the stove top to keep them flat instead of bubbling up with air pockets. This durable press is similar in quality to presses I’ve used in professional kitchens. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A.X.

customer_reviews.title: Bellemain Cast Iron Grill Press, Heavy-duty bacon press with Wood Handle, 8.75-Inch Round
customer_reviews.text: The Bellemain Cast Iron Grill Press, Heavy-duty bacon press with Wood Handle, 8.75-Inch Round is so easy to use even a child can use it. All you have to do is first cure it several times at around 350 and you have a lifetime item that if you followed the direction you'll have no rust and perfectly straight bacon or well done hamburgers.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. G.

customer_reviews.title: Just recently purchased a gas grill and was recommended by friends to get a grill press
customer_reviews.text: Just recently purchased a gas grill and was recommended by friends to get a grill press. Based on reviews, I went with the Bellemain Cast Iron Grill Press. It arrived, hand rubbed with vegetable oil to season. I used for the 1st time this weekend and was very pleased. Very well made, nice and heavy and very sturdy. Will definitely recomment to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: DGH

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly well made
customer_reviews.text: How hard is it to make a bacon press? Apparently it is somewhat difficult. The one I received has chunks missing from the edges . The finish over the missing chunks is nicely done. There were no instructions included with the press on how to season it, so if you are not familiar with proper seasoning of case iron, buy a cast iron pan and read its instructions. Just a little bit irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Greg from the NC piedmont

customer_reviews.title: What a wonder!
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted one of these bad boys for years, but just never got around to purchasing one. I am so glad I waited because I was all set on getting the rectangle shaped press. This one is so much better on so many levels!. First, my order arrived extremely fast. The seasoning is just like any of your cast iron skillets and clean up was a breeze. Why did i wait so long? I was just waiting for this one!
customer_reviews.author: Connie J. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This press is of excellent quality, heavy and easy to use. Once seasoned, it is also fairly easy to clean (it's cast iron which is never "easy" to clean as it has to be hand-washed). If I had any criticism of the item, it would be that it could be slightly smaller (8.5 rather than 8.75 inches) in circumference to better fit in smaller, standard sized frying pans without scraping the sides of the pan.
customer_reviews.author: byrdie2

customer_reviews.title: It's Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I ordered this bacon press! It fits perfectly in the pan I like to use for bacon; it helps keep bacon spatter/popping down; and the wooden handle stays comfortable to touch through-out cooking. I've not yet tried it for grilled cheese sandwiches but I'm sure it'll work great! Great little gadget.
customer_reviews.author: mommamary

customer_reviews.title: No more curled bacon!
customer_reviews.text: Frying bacon can sometimes be frustrating because it tends to curl at the edges when cooking. I've even had to cut off the ends at times because they were not crisp because of the curl. Bought this grill press, used it the first time and bacon stayed flat and evenly cooked. I have used this press many times since and the bacon always comes out just the way I like it. Easy to clean and maintain if you follow the directions for prepping it before use, and cleaning it afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This bacon press is easy to use and easy to clean. I'd never used one until recently, when I began cooking in an iron skillet. It causes the bacon to lie flat and cook evenly. Love the skillet, love the bacon press, love the meat I'm cooking!
customer_reviews.author: CHP WebShopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice heavy utensil, well constructed and excellent for creating 'smash' burgers!! It's also great on bacon, by the way. It's the perfect size to use in a fry pan and also on a griddle. The graphics are fun and even if you don't use it on bacon, it's great for other meat and even veggie burger applications!!
customer_reviews.author: NotSo IdleCuriosity

customer_reviews.title: Great Press
customer_reviews.text: Product works great! My wife mentioned she like to have a bacon press I did a search on AMAZON and saw your product. I asked if she wanted round or square and she chose round. The press arrived and the very next day while at work I receive a text picture of some nicely pressed bacon ! With a text saying how much she loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: I like the round version press
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality press and it's round! Yes, bacon is not round but my pan is. Like any cast iron product proper care is the key. Wash it with warm soapy water and dry. Apply a very light coat of olive oil and your ready for your next cook.
customer_reviews.author: mytoocentz

customer_reviews.title: Gets you the perfect sear!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I have used the press for both bacon and steak in my cast iron skillet. The press does a great job of preventing the bacon from curling up and gets it a nice even cook. I usually cook my steak using a sous vide and get the sear in my cast iron skillet. The press has significantly improved the sear on my steaks. The sear now covers the whole area of my steaks pressed against the skillet due to the weight of the press which also prevents curling. I love it so far and would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ironman

customer_reviews.title: Well made and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a flat top grill a month or so ago and after cooking on it a few times I could see where a bacon press would be worth having. I looked around locally and online and found these to be the best price for the size that they were. Picked up a couple of them and am not disappointed. Very well made and work extremely well. I really like that they came with instructions on how to season them before use. I already knew to do this but that little bit of extra effort showed me that the maker cared just a little bit more than the average company. Get these and you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Keeps bacon flat. Both sides cook well.
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought as many moons ago. I don’t have to flip my bacon over, just keep the cover on for a few minutes longer and both sides are crispy. Very nice product to have.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Great press. Im-pressive!
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product and happens to fit my skillet perfectly. I have used it on steaks, burgers, pork chops, and bacon and it produces an even sear and crispy bacon with less gas. The seasoning was thin out the box so I oiled it and heated it in the skillet for a bit and it turned black. Now it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: John G DC

customer_reviews.title: Love Crispy Bacon? Read this...
customer_reviews.text: Built to last this has cut cooking time in half. Its my favorite new utensil in the kitchen. Its not easy to clean, but its an awesome tool tool to make delicious crispy bacon! It is built to last forever just hard to clean off bacon grease. Still I'm so happy about my purchase, because I love crispy bacon!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: The good thing about the press is that it already comes ...
customer_reviews.text: The Bellemain bacon press does not necessarily have to be used for bacon only, the weight of the press is heavy enough to use on other food groups. The good thing about the press is that it already comes pre-seasoned & only a final top coat seal is needed which is great; unlike many other cast iron products, one has to wait a certain amount of time before the cast iron is fully seasoned. Given the items mentioned above, I have already started using the press & I am loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Lotay

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one of these.....
customer_reviews.text: I love this large round bacon press. It's the perfect size for my largest round frying pan. I find it impossible to get my bacon extra crispy the way we like it without a grill press. It's the only way to keep the bacon flat in the pan. I got the idea from Waffle House and it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Link

customer_reviews.title: Limited Use, But Came In Perfect Condition
customer_reviews.text: This is a Christmas present for my grill crazy husband, so my actual use has been limited. It's cast iron, so it needs seasoning. It's a little on the heavy side, but that's to be expected. What I'm bragging about is the swiftness that it arrived. Also, it came to me in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: LF Gillis

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Press - Bacon or Burgers
customer_reviews.text: Received this last week, seasoned it, and have already used it for both bacon and smash burgers. At 8.5", it fits PERFECTLY in the bottom of my favorite 10.25" high carbon skillet. Do be careful because the edges where the wood handle meets the metal get hot. Touched the edge once and only once. :) Otherwise, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect new tool for my kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to make the best diner style bacon to render the fat out to make eggs with. I seasoned it as it said and it's going to definitely get an amazing patina on it soon. It'll definitely be used to sear burgers and steaks, and veggies also. Just the perfect tool for my kitchen. Make sure to drain oil before it starts to pass the press' rigid side. It could splatter if it gets past that. It also can control splatters better than a splatter screen, or at least for me it does.
customer_reviews.author: Avel

customer_reviews.title: Rusted upon first wash
customer_reviews.text: My bacon press rusted terribly the first time I (hand) washed it. Not worth it. Do not intend on using again for fear of toxins/rust contaminating my bacon.
customer_reviews.author: Reece

customer_reviews.title: Great press
customer_reviews.text: Product is great quality and is perfect for grilling or the kitchen. For the bad reviews in regards to rust, it's cast iron, with all cast iron it must be seasoned. Clearly the people who gave bad reviews do not know how to use cast iron. This is a great product
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: A simple tool that does what it was made to do
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I like bacon (who doesn’t), and I dislike standing at the stove trying to train several slices at a time. So I bought this bacon press, and (you will be amazed) it does just what it claims to do. The weight is sufficient to press the bacon firmly to the pan. Cleaning and maintenance have been straightforward. I haven’t had it long enough to verify it’s long term quality, but given that it is a heavy piece of metal it probably will last as long as I do.
customer_reviews.author: D. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect combination of quality and value
customer_reviews.text: This bacon press is perfect. It’s the perfect size for a pan full of bacon and it is very sturdy and heavy duty. The quality of this product is unmatched of any similar product from any other company. It’s very easy to clean and it’s exactly what I was looking for. Awesome product at an awesome price. Nothing “cheap” about this bacon press!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Dodd

customer_reviews.title: BEST Bacon Press
customer_reviews.text: We've used the Cast Iron Grill Press for bacon, sausage and burgers on our Blackstone Griddle. What a huge difference in the quality of what we are grilling, the ridges in the bottom allow grease to flow away from what we're grilling and keeps the meat flat. Can't say enough good about this product. Will purchase another for our grill crazy son too!
customer_reviews.author: Barb Park

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect bacon
customer_reviews.text: Are used it today for the first time and the bacon came out perfect. Best bacon I’ve had in a long time. The press worked great and the bacon came out totally flat ready to make into a bacon lettuce and tomato sandwich.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kitchen ware
customer_reviews.text: My husband the Chef loves this product. The bacon presser is very sturdy and heavy. It also works well with cooking burgers and grill cheese sandwiches. On some pans, it can be used as a top cover while heating food. We both love this product and hope it last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: First grill press. Purchased because of size for use in 12" carbon steel skillet. Works great. Very easy to season. Coated once with a wax oil compound and placed in skillet on medium low heat as recommended. That single season was all that was required. Have used for bacon and rib eye steaks. Both cook much faster without Bacon Curling. Only reason for not giving all 5 stars was the wood handle is a little difficult to remove oil once it gets slick. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KYReads

customer_reviews.title: BACON PRESS- Great product built strong and solid
customer_reviews.text: BACON PRESS- Great product built strong and solid. At a weight of 3 pounds, it is more than a bacon press. It is great for pressing grilled toasted sandwiches (less cost than a panini maker) and is also great for grilling meats to get good contact and seared surfaces. Any avid cook will find many uses for an item like this, once you have it in your tool box. I rate it a 5 out of 5 for quality, weight, and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Nickell

customer_reviews.title: Our family appreciates this new kitchen tool..
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves this grill press! We are all using it on a regular basis and especially appreciate the quality of the product, which includes an attractive yet durable wooden handle. Just yesterday our 8 yo old used this cute yet highly functional press to make his bacon "perfect and extra crispy," and he's ready to make panini style sandwiches with us for dinner. Cheers to getting kids wanting to cook in the kitchen!! This cast iron grill press gets 5 stars from our family!
customer_reviews.author: S Frank

customer_reviews.title: Impressive grill press for a home kitchen

customer_reviews.author: Mammadoc

customer_reviews.title: Great product, measure your pan first!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I was tired of my bacon constantly curling up. It does exactly what it's supposed to do. Only downfall was my own fault. My plan of choice for cooking bacon didn't have a large enough base for the press to sit in. I didn't think this through when I bought it so my only suggestion is make sure it will fit all the way to the bottom of your pan. I just changed plans and I love how it works. I usually sit it in the pan to get it a little hot first and it cooks the bacon super fast.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Lightfritz

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for anyone who uses a griddle.

Have used it probably five times already from everything from chicken and bacon and even mashing down my squash and mushrooms onto my griddle.

customer_reviews.title: Bellemain Grill Press
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Bellemain Bacon Press thru Amazon. I have used it three times already and its great. On a scale from one to five, I would give it five stars. Good quality, heavy duty press that helps keep bacon and hamburgers properly pressed. I have been cooking bacon for years, and just sorry didn’t have this little jewel back then. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Gary Z

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the bacon flat
customer_reviews.text: What I found was that you had to flip the bacon a couple of times because it gets cooked faster on the bottom than the top where the grill press is. Kept the bacon flat and fit nicely in a couple of my pans. Some longer pieces of bacon stick out past the press. Best to get shorter pieces.

customer_reviews.title: Buy Kitchen buy last year

Nice product
